instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: 820 00165 no power, board has 2 tiny spots of liquid damage on Q7630 and U1930. Magsafe lights, 8.57v on PPBUS. PP5V_S5 is present, when I measure voltage for PP5V_S3 at L4011 and R6414 I get 0, but when I take a measurement at L4605 I get a reading that jumps all over, very strange. I have replaced U1930 due to it looking like shit.

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: PPVRTC_G3H present and stable? PPBUS Stable? PP5v_S4RS3 present?

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
Do you get steady 5V at L7520?
What about the other big coils?

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
PPBUS 8.57v stable
PPVRTC 3.346 stable
PP5V_S4RS3 0v
L7520 0v
L7560 3.347v

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_SUS?
If not, check PM_SLP_SUS_L.
PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing at least?
L7520 should pulse at same time.
If yes, check if other coils pulse too.
Is better to check toggling SMC_ONOFF_L signal; use R5115/16 pads for this...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
PP3V3_SUS 3.346v stable
PM_SLP_S4_L 0V no pulsing at least that I can seen on my Fluke, I dont have a scope
SMC_ONOFF_L 3.427v stable

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
"Is better to check toggling SMC_ONOFF_L signal; use R5115/16 pads for this..."
You need to see any reaction.

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: 2info, I dont understand what you are asking me to do. Are you telling me to short the pads?

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: Exactly, like pressing power button...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: Yeah, unfortunately im still getting no change bridging those pads.

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
Check S5_PWRGD, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWRMEN, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_BATLOW_L.
Does MLB start on SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
S5_PWRGD 3.399v
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.426v
PCH_DSWRMEN 3.248v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.426v
PM_BATLOW_L 3.343v
Not sure what you mean by SMC bypass mode, but I cant get this board to do anything as far as turning on.

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: Press power button, connect charger and maintain pressing 5-10s...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: With SMC bypass i get about 2 seconds of fan spin, then nothing after that.

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
"i get about 2 seconds of fan spin"
That means L7520 gets voltage in this time.
Check which other big coils get voltage...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
At least L7520 must get 5V, if fan spins!
So check voltages in these 2 seconds...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: L7520 is not getting 5v, for those 2 seconds that the fan spins, I get a different voltage each time it comes on anywhere between .855-4.3v

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
So L7520 pulses; you can see 5V with o-scope, not DC multimeter.
Check which other coils pulse too...
Also check if ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulsing?

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: ALL_SYS_PWRGD does not seem to be pulsing, unfortunately I do not have an o scope

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
A DC multimeter should be good enough.
You will not catch the nominal voltage expected, but can see if pulse.
Just toggle SMC_ONOFF_L repeatedly...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: I will try again, I know sometimes it takes a few trys, but I literally connected and wiggled those pads probably 50 times the other day.

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: Solder a wire on SMC_ONOFF_L pad and touch the ground (any metal plate of chassis), to simulate power button...

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message: I have tried to short the pads with multiple tools, have soldered a wire, nothing is happening toggling SMC_ONOFF

threads.title: 820 00165 No Power
threads.message:
Check for pulse on all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals.
Strange to get pulsing only L7520...
